channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Big investors are afraid of the stock market, and the S&P 500’s path to 7,000 just got easier.
item.description: Wobbles by the S&P 500 near fresh highs has caused skittish behavior by Wall Street’s smart money recently. That will help smooth a path to 7,000, say...

item.title: ‘The gold market is rarely wrong.’ Why stocks and bitcoin are in a danger zone.
item.description: S&P 500 at 5,700? Bitcoin at $80,000? Trader Jeffrey Bierman says the market is running on fumes and “FOMO.”

item.title: Two Social Security problems that seem almost impossible to fix
item.description: The “Social Security squeeze” is coming for your benefits. Can the program’s most existential problems be solved?

item.title: Why BlackRock may not need to pay a big premium for a $38 billion energy acquisition
item.description: Shares in U.S. power company AES Corp. spiked more than 15% in premarket trading Wednesday after BlackRock-owned GIP was reported by the Financial Tim...

item.title: Trump sees Lithium Americas as a vital investment. Here’s why Wall Street agrees.
item.description: The Trump administration is taking a stake in Lithium Americas as part of its strategy to invest in industries seen as vital for national security.

item.title: Here's what major Wall Street banks are telling clients to do about the shutdown
item.description: Wall Street banks largely told clients to expect a typical short shutdown and bet on a comeback in stocks if there's any major weakness.

item.title: Carvana gets an upgrade from Jefferies, which says momentum for car retailer is picking up
item.description: Shares of the online car retailer have already outperformed this year, up more than 85%. Jefferies expects there's further upside.

item.title: Barclays downgrades AT&T to equal weight, says upside is limited after recent gains
item.description: AT&T has outperformed this year, climbing 24%, but is likely to face a more challenging environment ahead, the bank said.

item.title: The stock market usually doesn't care about government shutdowns. This time may not follow the script
item.description: The current funding dispute is raising concern among investors and strategists, who say the economic backdrop now is the weakest since 1990.
